title: Simón Bolívar
summary: Simón José Antonio de la Santísima Trinidad Bolívar y Ponte Palacios y Blanco[1] (English: /ˈbɒlɪvər, -vɑːr/ BOL-iv-ər, -⁠ar,[2] also US: /ˈboʊlɪvɑːr/ BOH-liv-ar,[3] Spanish: [siˈmom boˈliβaɾ] (listen);[lower-alpha 1] 24 July 1783 – 17 December 1830), also colloquially as El Libertador,[4] or Liberator of America,[5][6] was a Venezuelan military and political leader who led what are currently the countries of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama to independence from the Spanish Empire.
